message_1: If a Vigenere cipher with a keyword "MATH" is used to encrypt the message "CRYPTOGRAPHY", what is the resulting ciphertext?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "CRYPTOGRAPHY" using a Vigenere cipher with the keyword "MATH", we first need to repeat the keyword to match the length of the message:

MATHMATHMATHM

Now, we use the Vigenere cipher table to find the corresponding ciphertext for each letter in the message:

C (with M) -> O
R (with A) -> R
Y (with T) -> B
P (with H) -> F
T (with M) -> Z
O (with A) -> O
G (with T) -> W
R (with H) -> Z
A (with M) -> M
P (with A) -> P
H (with T) -> W
Y (with H) -> B

So, the resulting ciphertext is "ORBFWZOWZMPW".
